transcripts.text: Welcome to Hard Questions, where we discuss your hard questions and answer them from the Bible.  I'm Tom Hollis, the moderator for this panel, and the panel is made up of...
Dr.  William R. Glaze, Bethany Baptist Church in Pittsburgh.
Ray Heupel, Providence Presbyterian Church in Robinson Township.
Pete Giacalone, Rainbow Temple Assembly Guide Church in McKeesport, Pennsylvania.
And Tim Bergen, the Christian Center of Ross Traver Township.

All right, pastors, I got a two-parter for you here.  What does this Bible say about ghosts?  And do you believe that mediums, you know, like the ones you see on TV that talk to the dead, do they really connect with dead loved ones?  Go ahead.

Well, you know, I always go back to when we deal with this topic, the book of Ephesians.  In Ephesians chapter 6, in verse 12, it says, For we wrestle not against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of darkness of this world, against spiritual wickedness in high places.  And I think that, you know, to me now, I'm not sure where everybody else is going to go, but when I see stuff like this, it just enters the field of the demonic world.
So you're not saying it's a ghost of a dead loved one, but a demon or something impersonal.

If God wants to send somebody back, he can do it.  I'm not going to preclude that.  If he wants to do it, but I'm just saying a lot of stuff that we see, I believe the answer is found in Ephesians 6.12.

I think as we look at scriptures, the only thing that would come close to this was the situation when Saul saw a median, right?  And as pastors, we had to realize, now, was this, did the prophet actually arise or was a lying spirit that arose at that particular time?
But it was Samuel that came back, right?  So I think that was God.
Well, I think the key there is that the fortune teller freaked out.
Right.

So she knew she was fake.  She knew she was pulling it out.  And to see something real, because if God could bring back Elijah and Moses and, you know, and there could be, right, then he can do anything.  he wants to deliver a message.  Ghosts have been around for a long time.  I mean, the disciples saw Jesus walking on the water and said, it's a ghost.  Yeah.  So the idea of a ghost, but the problem is what Paul said, and Bill used this in an earlier program, that to be absent from the body is to be present with the Lord.  So you're either instantly in heaven or hell or wherever.  There's not that... that opportunity to be hanging around.

Yeah, and I would agree with that.  I think other than those few exceptions where God did even through that, you know, charlatan allow Samuel to come forward because Saul was going to be rebuked by him.  And you see, you know, a few other places where maybe God allowed Elijah, you know, and so forth on Moses to appear in some fashion with Jesus.  But other than that, when a person dies... their spirit either goes to be with the Lord or their spirit goes to the place of punishment.  And we know that there is a truth, right?  There are spiritual beings.  I think that's the truth behind this, right?  That, you know, even the old translations speak of the Holy Spirit as the Holy Ghost.  You know, and I even sometimes pray that way in church.  You know, Father, Son, and Holy Ghost.  I grew up with that language.  And that's referring to the fact that there is a spiritual realm.  We each have spirits.  And so, you know, I think there's a truth there.  But really, once we die, I mean, our spirit goes to its final place.  And, you know, not to deny that there's another judgment coming, you know, when Jesus returns and all that.  I'm not saying that.  But you don't get to hang around.  I think that's Hollywood.

Everything that God has done, Satan will mimic or counterfeit.  And there's so much counterfeit out there.  Again, to be absent from the body is the presence of the Lord.  And like what you said, it's not the idea of lingering.  So what's the enemy going to do?  He's going to come in and cause confusion to make us think that we can communicate with the dead.
I have a follow-up question, but I wanted to get the bill.

Well, I was just going to say, you know, Paul said that don't be amazed because Satan can transform himself into an angel of light.  A lot of things, people are going to these individuals looking for answers.  That's my follow up question.

Why is there such an increased amount of interest in this?  There's TV shows all over the place now.  There's ghost hunters and things like that.  There's an increased interest.  We talked off camera about the stars, how they seek out mediums and things like that.

What Why is that?  Well, I think that as we progress into the last days, and really, you know, since the time of Jesus, we've really kind of been in the last days.  But I think that as we progress more and more, the Bible says that, you know, there will be a heightening of, you know, spiritual activity, of demonic activity.  And so I think that's one of the things that we're seeing.  And plus, if you look at it, you know, back in Jesus' day, it was there.  But, you know, you look at all the technology that we have today.  And I think that, you know, Satan is using this technology to really, you know, stir up people's minds, stir up people's souls, and put something in them that they're being drawn, you know, to these mediums and these psychics.
And if possible, to deceive the very elect.  Yeah.  Wow.  That's powerful.

I think that as Christianity and the truth, right, wanes in our culture and in our country, because the spiritual is real, something's going to take the void.  And, you know, 50 years ago, certainly 100 years ago, these sort of things weren't happening, you know, on a daily basis or in such a public way.  I mean, you can go online and join vampire groups and witch groups and all these things.  And, you know, and they all have some sort of credibility among people because... We've lost the truth.  We don't go to the scriptures anymore.  And so anything goes, I guess.

And to go along with what Ray said, as human beings, we naturally have an inclination to try to cheat and do the easy thing.  Rather than depending upon God for finances, we steal.  Rather than waiting for God to justify us, we lie, we defend.  And rather than people waiting to hear from God and to learn what God has to say, they'll go to somebody.  that will tickle their ears and make them feel better.  And I believe there are times where the demonic is used here to speak a word into someone's life and then the demonic makes it happen.  It's not that they see the future, it's the demonic makes it happen in situations like that and people believe it.  I've seen that in other cultures around the world.  But there needs to be a point where we understand that God will speak to us if we spend that time to wait and hear from him.  He speaks through his word.  He speaks through other men and women of God.  And he'll speak quietly to our spirits if we'll allow it.

You know, I think that's the reason why in the Old Testament that these things were condemned so soundly by the Word of God.  Because what does it mean if I go to a palm reader or if I go to a fortune teller?  What am I saying?  I'm saying I don't trust God for the future.  I have to know the future so that I can figure it out and get the best out of it because I know God's not going to give me the best.  I mean, really, when I try to figure out the future, I'm saying I don't trust God.

And the other thing is that And we know this is that wherever there's a void, something will come in and fill that void.  Thank God for us as Christians that we have a relationship with Jesus Christ and that void is filled in our life.  And I hope to God, and I don't know of any Christians that, and there might be that are going to psychics and medium.  But I just think that we have that void filled with the Holy Spirit and that relationship.  And a lot of these people don't have, they got that void and they're looking to fill that void.
And it's trusting God rather than like the whole thing behind witchcraft that is to try to affect the events rather than say, God, I'm praying and I'm trusting you.

You'll notice when you say witchcraft, a lot of people don't really pay attention that that's a work of the flesh.  It's not necessarily a spiritual thing.  It's a work of the flesh and it's our flesh constantly striving to be like God and to make our own way rather than waiting and saying, God, you know what?  I really want to hear from you.  I want to spend the time hearing from you.

That's right.  Well, thank you, gentlemen.  We just want to have answers for you in every question.  So please send us your hard questions.  Any questions you have, the Bible has an answer.  We'll be back right after this.
